history.content:
Not sure why git is not a recognized command, I would try maybe reinstalling Git Bash, since installing it should install git and add it to path.

A quick explanation of what happens when you type "git" or "python" or "java" into the terminal; your terminal looks in all the locations in your system's "PATH" variable, and tries to find an executable with the given name. For example, I have C:/Program Files/Java/jdk-10.0.01/bin in my path, and that's how my terminal recognizes the commands "java" and "javac":

So first you should check to make sure you have Python and the JDK installed, and then you should check to make sure that you have the Java and Python folders in your path. There are complete instructions for Python on the CS61A page, and for Java on the CS61B page.

Hi classmates, 

I have Gitbash downloaded, but for some reason, git, python and java aren't recognized commands. Has anyone else had the same issue, and if so, could you please give me some pointers on how to fix this issue?

Thanks!
history.subject: Regarding GitBash
